Posted By: dragonking987 (8/26/2010 12:10:49 PM)

posts.post_content: Even without infinite combos, you receive pretty much for your three mana! :) Obviously, you want to create many black creature tokens, but unfortunately, this is not easy because black creature tokens are usually larger and require much effort, just take a look at [Zombie Infestation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zombie Infestation).. My two suggestions are [Skirk Ridge Exhumer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skirk Ridge Exhumer), who creates little black 1/1 creature tokens that really want to leave play, and [Worm Harvest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worm Harvest), also one of the most potent creature token engine cards! :) Together with this card right here and [Twilight Drover](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twilight Drover), of course..
posts.html:
Even without infinite combos, you receive pretty much for your three mana! :) Obviously, you want to create many black creature tokens, but unfortunately, this is not easy because black creature tokens are usually larger and require much effort, just take a look at Zombie Infestation.. My two suggestions are Skirk Ridge Exhumer, who creates little black 1/1 creature tokens that really want to leave play, and Worm Harvest, also one of the most potent creature token engine cards! :) Together with this card right here and Twilight Drover, of course..

posts.post_content: Great fun with [Hero of Bladehold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hero of Bladehold). You can declare that you're attacking with the Hero, whereupon you get the white soldier tokens, then use those tokens as part of the sacrifice to knock out a big defender.

Posted By: Lavrant (5/22/2011 9:28:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Don't forget [Glamerdye](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glamerdye), or [Alter Reality](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alter Reality), or [Mind Bend](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Bend), or [Sleight of Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sleight of Mind), or [Spectral Shift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Shift); or until end of turn you can use [Whim of Volrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whim of Volrath), or [Crystal Spray](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crystal Spray). Change white to black, or black to white. Or play [Painter's Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servant), naming black. Whichever you prefer. Free creature removal, and looping creatures. Throw in [Artificial Evolution](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Artificial Evolution) for your tribal decks. If it's just looping you want, not the removal, then opt for [Shifting Sky](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shifting Sky) naming black, or the afore-mentioned [Darkest Hour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darkest Hour).
posts.html:
Don't forget Glamerdye, or Alter Reality, or Mind Bend, or Sleight of Mind, or Spectral Shift; or until end of turn you can use Whim of Volrath, or Crystal Spray. Change white to black, or black to white. Or play Painter's Servant, naming black. Whichever you prefer. Free creature removal, and looping creatures. Throw in Artificial Evolution for your tribal decks. If it's just looping you want, not the removal, then opt for Shifting Sky naming black, or the afore-mentioned Darkest Hour.

posts.post_content: With [Darkest Hour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darkest Hour) in play, there will be no white creatures for Teysa to sacrifice; all creatures are black. So yes, you will need a third card to make a loop. Unless you just use your guys as infinite blockers, which works quite well too.

posts.post_content:
Teysa Karlov  
  
The main character of the Guildpact novel. Equal parts ambition and execution. With a few well-chosen words and a couple of well-planned smiles, she can make practically anyone dance to her tune. She is an Orzhov advokist (lawyer), but retires early to become the baroness of the Utvara region. She also makes an appearance in the Dissension novel. (Card:Teysa, Orzhov Scion)  
  
http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/List\_of\_Magic:\_The\_Gathering\_characters:\_T#section\_35
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
One of my favorite commanders. I have a fun token deck built around her with some fun synergies:  
[Necromancer's Covenant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancer's Covenant), [Cathars' Crusade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cathars' Crusade), and combining Persist (in Shadowmoor b/w cards) and Undying for reusable, sacrificed creatures. The combination of colors and abilities of this commander makes a very creative and random game :)
posts.html:
One of my favorite commanders. I have a fun token deck built around her with some fun synergies:
Necromancer's Covenant, Cathars' Crusade, and combining Persist (in Shadowmoor b/w cards) and Undying for reusable, sacrificed creatures. The combination of colors and abilities of this commander makes a very creative and random game :)
